workouts.description: Complete rest day to allow for full recovery. Focus on hydration and nutrition.
Warm-up (10-15 min easy), then 6 x 800m repeats at 5K-10K race pace with equal recovery jogs (e.g., 800m easy jog). Focus on maintaining good form during the fast segments. Cool-down (5-10 min easy).
Complete rest day to allow for full recovery. Focus on hydration and nutrition.
Warm-up (10 min easy), then 20 minutes at a comfortably hard pace (you can speak short sentences, but not full conversations). This should be a sustained effort. Cool-down (5 min easy).
Complete rest day to allow for full recovery. Focus on hydration and nutrition.

Steady, easy-to-moderate pace. Focus on maintaining a consistent, conversational effort to build endurance. Hydrate well before, during, and after. Prioritize keeping heart rate down, especially in the first half. If HR spikes, slow down or walk.

Focus on maintaining a very low heart rate (Zone 1-2). It should feel effortlessly easy, conversational pace. This is crucial for recovery and aerobic base building. If your HR is high, slow down or walk. Prioritize HR over pace.
Complete rest day to allow for full recovery. Focus on hydration and nutrition.
Warm-up (10-15 min easy), then 5 x 1000m repeats at 10K race pace with 2-3 min recovery jogs in between. Focus on maintaining good form during the fast segments. Cool-down (5-10 min easy).
Complete rest day to allow for full recovery. Focus on hydration and nutrition.
Warm-up (10 min easy), then 25 minutes at a comfortably hard pace (you can speak short sentences, but not full conversations). This should be a sustained effort. Cool-down (5 min easy).
Complete rest day to allow for full recovery. Focus on hydration and nutrition.

Steady, easy-to-moderate pace. Focus on maintaining a consistent, conversational effort to build endurance. Hydrate well before, during, and after. Prioritize keeping heart rate down, especially in the first half. If HR spikes, slow down or walk.

Focus on maintaining a very low heart rate (Zone 1-2). It should feel effortlessly easy, conversational pace. This is crucial for recovery and aerobic base building. If your HR is high, slow down or walk. Prioritize HR over pace.
Complete rest day to allow for full recovery. Focus on hydration and nutrition.
Warm-up (10-15 min easy), then 4 x 1200m repeats at slightly slower than 10K race pace with 3-4 min recovery jogs. Focus on maintaining good form during the fast segments. Cool-down (5-10 min easy).
Complete rest day to allow for full recovery. Focus on hydration and nutrition.
Warm-up (10 min easy), then 30 minutes at a comfortably hard pace (you can speak short sentences, but not full conversations). This should be a sustained effort. Cool-down (5 min easy).
Complete rest day to allow for full recovery. Focus on hydration and nutrition.

Steady, easy-to-moderate pace. Focus on maintaining a consistent, conversational effort to build endurance. Hydrate well before, during, and after. Prioritize keeping heart rate down, especially in the first half. If HR spikes, slow down or walk.

Focus on maintaining a very low heart rate (Zone 1-2). It should feel effortlessly easy, conversational pace. This is crucial for recovery and aerobic base building. If your HR is high, slow down or walk. Prioritize HR over pace.
Complete rest day to allow for full recovery. Focus on hydration and nutrition. This is a cutback week to absorb training.
Warm-up (10 min easy), then 8 x 400m repeats at faster than 5K race pace with 200-400m recovery jogs. Focus on quick leg turnover and good form. Cool-down (5 min easy).
Complete rest day to allow for full recovery. Focus on hydration and nutrition. This is a cutback week to absorb training.

Focus on maintaining a very low heart rate (Zone 1-2). It should feel effortlessly easy, conversational pace. This is crucial for recovery and aerobic base building. If your HR is high, slow down or walk. Prioritize HR over pace.
Complete rest day to allow for full recovery. Focus on hydration and nutrition. This is a cutback week to absorb training.
Steady, easy-to-moderate pace. This is a medium-long run for the cutback week. Focus on maintaining a consistent, conversational effort. Hydrate well. Prioritize keeping heart rate down.
Complete rest day to allow for full recovery. Focus on hydration and nutrition. This is a cutback week to absorb training.
Complete rest day to allow for full recovery. Taper week for performance.
Warm-up (10 min easy), then 4 x 200m striders at near max effort with long recovery walks (200m). Focus on speed and form, not endurance. Cool-down (5 min easy).
Complete rest day to allow for full recovery. Taper week for performance.
A very light shakeout run. Focus on maintaining a very low heart rate (Zone 1-2). It should feel effortlessly easy, conversational pace. Include 4-6 x 100m strides at the end to keep legs fresh.
Complete rest day to allow for full recovery. Taper week for performance.

Option 1 (Race): Run a local 5K Parkrun or similar race aiming for a new personal best. Option 2 (Tempo): Warm-up (10 min easy), then 20 minutes at a comfortably hard pace (Tempo effort). Cool-down (5 min easy). Choose based on how you feel and if a race is available.
Complete rest day to allow for full recovery after your performance run. Focus on hydration and nutrition.
